snippet: Richard J. Combs, the former police chief of Eutawville, S.C., faces possible life imprisonment for shooting an unarmed black man, Bernard Bailey.
abstract: Former South Carolina police chief Richard J Combs testifies in his murder trial, telling jury why he shot and killed unarmed black man Bernard Bailey; faces possible life imprisonment if found guilty.
lead_paragraph: Richard J. Combs, the former police chief of Eutawville, S.C., faces possible life imprisonment for shooting an unarmed black man, Bernard Bailey.

headline.main: Ex-Police Chief Tells South Carolina Jury Why He Shot Unarmed Black Man
headline.print_headline: Ex-Police Chief Testifies at Trial in 2011 Killing
